title: The Super-Slim Insulated Koozie That Fits My White Claw Like a Glove
text:
6 items in this article Photo: Courtesy of the Retailer

On one particularly toasty summer day, spent bobbing around on my uncle’s boat, I realized that not only were all of my cousins drinking White Claws, but that they were all using the same insulated koozie to keep them ice cold: the BrüMate Hopsulator Slim Double Insulated Can Cooler (a mouthful, I know). When my cousin excitedly told me she bought them after getting a targeted Instagram ad, I rolled my eyes, sure that this was another gimmicky ’gram product that nobody needed. We cracked our second round, and as I sipped at my seltzer, wondering (for the thousandth time this summer) whether I even liked these in the first place, my Michelob Ultra-loving uncle (who only drinks his beer in slim cans, never bottles) explained that he had conducted tests with the Hopsulator. His conclusive scientific findings are hard to argue with: The cans could sit out for close to an hour in direct sunlight on a hot day without losing their cool, due to the double-walled stainless steel.

After about 30 minutes, as I was choking down the last lukewarm dregs of my drink, my cousin passed me her can of black cherry-flavored spiked seltzer nestled safely in the BrüMate. “Now try this,” she said. I took a sip and discovered that her drink was as ice cold as when she first cracked it open straight from the cooler.

The Hopsulator Slim presents a solution to a problem I hadn’t really noticed before becoming a hard-seltzer drinker: Most koozies are only designed to fit standard 12-ounce cans. And trying to fit a slim can in one of those creates a twofold problem: not only does your drink lose its cool faster, it’s an awkward fit. (Of course, BrüMate also sells a can cooler for standard 12-ounce cans, and even 24-ounce cans, to fit whichever beer brand you prefer.) And a soft koozie doesn’t really compare: They don’t have nearly the same degree of insulating power.

I was also surprised to find that my family of hardcore Yeti users thought the BrüMate Hopsulator was just as good. And while they are about the same price, Yeti has yet to make a cooler designed for slim cans. The Hopsulator also comes in a variety of kicky colors ranging from standard blush pink to the more daring “glitter merlot,” as well as more subdued tones like matte gray and navy. And I am not alone in my undying love for the Hopsulator: over 1,300 devotees have left glowing reviews on Amazon (91 percent of which give it five stars.)

While the summer of hard seltzer may be winding down, the BrüMate Hopsulator Slim Double Insulated Can Cooler will keep your beverage of choice frosty year-round — especially if that drink is packaged in a slim can.
